definition: to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: The preface will review the history of Theory of Intentional Fallacy.
sentences.chinese: 本文要探讨的是意图谬见论的文学批评学意义。

sentences.english: The crumbling away of prejudices and errors causes light.
sentences.chinese: 邪说和谬见的崩溃造成了光明。

sentences.english: TYPICAL USE:It is a popular fallacy to suppose that riches always bring happiness.
sentences.chinese: 假定财富永远带来幸福是常有的谬见。

sentences.english: It's a popular fallacy that success always brings happiness.
sentences.chinese: 认为成功总是带来幸福是一种普遍的谬见。

sentences.english: This thesis wants to find the significance of Theory of Intentional Fallacy to literary criticism.
sentences.chinese: 本文要探讨的是意图谬见论的文学批评学意义。

sentences.english: It is a fallacy to say that the camera never lies.
sentences.chinese: 说照相机绝不骗人，这是谬见。

definition: dualism, belief that the universe is made of two different substance (e.g. mind and matter or good and evil)
philosophy of idealism, the doctrine that external reality is a product of consciousness
to reverse cause and effect/to put the horse before the cart
high sounding and impractical/high flown nonsense
not to be taken as an example/not an example to be followed/not to be taken as authoritative
strange tales and absurd arguments (idiom)/unreasonable remarks
